Articles.Content:
Hi all, I have recently downloaded the demo, and have after much fun and trying achieved a stable orbit, EVA, and the safe return of Jebediah Kerman! All this in a five stage monster of dubious construction! I feel like the King of Orbital Mechanics! I am rendering the video now in Sony Vegas, and as soon as its rendered and uploaded to YouTube, I'll pop it here. I think I'll be around Ã‚Â£20 shorter on payday as I'll be buying this fantastically fun game! I had watched pretty much ALL of Scott Manley's videos on YouTube, became interested, downloaded the demo, and became hooked! After only a few sacrificial Kerbals I got into a stable (if rather eccentric) orbit, made some maneuvers, and completed a safe return. I still feel pretty stoked up about this!

Just a quick warning, the name for my five stage monstrosity is a wee bit erm... adult? But not so much so...

I have never had so much fun in a game that I can play in windowed mode. I will be raiding these forums for ALL the information!!!

Thank you very much,

Brian
Welcome to the site and to the game!
The full game has bunches more parts, and many more destinations to fly to. You won't regret buying it.

Buy the game. Best purchase I've made in years!

Welcome to the game

Nobody is welcome to the game. The game hates you. You welcome the game taking over your life...

Sorry. I'm prone to spout random nonsense sometimes. Hope you have a good time with KSP and the Forums.

If you're enjoying the demo that much then you definitely need to be buying the full game. So much stuff to see and do. I'm 400 odd hours in and I've only scratched the surface.

Only downside is I can't get enough. I'm always coming up with new stuff to try and do, often failing.

Check out the screenshots in my Sig, some inspiration perhaps. Good luck and have fun.

Quick tip for you after watching the video, burn at the apoapsis and periapsis for best efficiency and more circular orbits.

Edited November 26, 2013 by Monkeh

I'm definitely buying the game!! even utter failure is fun...

I also have a dead Kerbal orbiting Mun, but I didn't get any video of that...

Thanks for the warm welcome all,

Brian
